item.ptxt: Use the same procedures for the LH side and RH side.
The procedures listed below are for the LH side.

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, pry out the set ring and cylinder boot.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the brake piston and cylinder.

s2.ptxt: Prepare a wooden block to hold the pistons.
Place the wooden plate between the piston and cylinder.
Use compressed air to remove the piston from the cylinder.

atten2.ptxt: Do not place your fingers in front of the piston when using compressed air.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to spatter the brake fluid.

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, pry out the seal from the cylinder.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the inner cylinder and cylinder groove.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DISC BRAKE BLEEDER PLUG CAP
REMOVE FRONT DISC BRAKE BLEEDER PLUG

s2.ptxt: Remove the bleeder plug from the cylinder.
